definition: to cleave/to split open/to spread open (fingers, legs)
to hack/to chop/to split open/(of lightning) to strike

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Objective To investigate the skin incision of the median sternotomy.
sentences.chinese: 目的探索胸骨正中劈開徑路理想的皮膚切口。

sentences.english: He taped a nail in slowly to spilt the thin board.
sentences.chinese: 他慢慢地把釘子釘進這塊簿板，以防劈開。

sentences.english: This axe was once used to hack an ex-girlfriends’ furniture.
sentences.chinese: 這把斧頭曾經劈開前女友的傢俱。

sentences.english: A good many more buds grew on the righthand side of the split surface than on the left.
sentences.chinese: 被劈開的表面上從右邊長出的幼芽比左邊多得多。

sentences.english: The murderer clove the man's head open with a sword.
sentences.chinese: 殺人犯用劍把那個男人的腦袋劈開了。

sentences.english: The second tree was cut and made into a small fishing boat.
sentences.chinese: 第二棵樹被劈開，做成了一艘小漁船。

sentences.english: The wood must be split up for fuel.
sentences.chinese: 必須把這塊木頭劈開作燃料。

sentences.english: The axe cleaved the piece of wood.
The Sword split the Knight's helmet and bit him fatally.
sentences.chinese: 劍劈開了騎士的頭盔並致命地刺進他。

sentences.english: The firemen broke the door in with axes.
sentences.chinese: 消防隊員們用斧頭把門劈開。

sentences.english: In a cornfield outside of town, farmers have sliced open an entire hill.
sentences.chinese: 在鎮外，農民已經劈開整座山。

sentences.english: This axe was once used to hack an ex-girlfriends' furniture.
sentences.chinese: 這把斧頭曾經劈開前女友的傢俱。

sentences.english: We used our knives to clear a path through the forest.
sentences.chinese: 我們用刀劈開一條路穿過森林。

sentences.english: It was designed by making use of the ground raw materials and made simple explaination of the working process.
sentences.chinese: 利用當地原料研製了劈開磚配方，並介紹了生產過程。

sentences.english: The fishing rod is made of split bamboo.
sentences.chinese: 這釣魚竿是用劈開的竹子做的。

sentences.english: Mating is as hard as the cleaving of the waters of the Red Sea.
sentences.chinese: 找對象之難，有如將紅海之水劈開一般。

definition: to cut open/to rip/to streak across (lightning, meteor etc)/to pierce (scream, searchlight etc)
half of sth/one side of sth
to break or cut in two/to sever/to cut off/(fig.) to cut off (a conversation, a flow etc)/to interrupt/(math.) to truncate
to be shocked/to be appalled/to be terrified
silver needle (fine needle used in acupuncture)
to push aside/to part/to brush away
